docTitle.titlePart: INVESTIGATIONS INTO THE NOISE CHARACTERISTICS OF DIGITIZED AERIAL IMAGES

byline.affiliation: Institut ff ur Photogrammetrie, Universitt at Bonn

front.reference: (Proceedings ISPRS Comm. II Symposium, Cambridge, UK, 13-17 July 1998)
front.keyword: KEY WORDS: noise variance, robust variance estimation, scanner characteristics, digitized transparencies
front.div:
ABSTRACT
For automated image evaluation a precise characterization of the noise behaviour of the image data is needed. Digital image
acquisition in aerial photogrammetry usually is performed by digitizing analogue material. The noise of the digital image
is composed of the noise due to the digitization process and of the noise of the analogue image. From a statistical point of
view, noise can be described by the standard deviation and the correlation of the of the intensity values. Our aim
is to determine a noise model out of the images itself, without the need of special test patterns. We do this by following
two approaches: pixelwise evaluation of multiple scans of the material and regionwise evaluation from a single scan. The
approach analyses the noise coming from the digitization process, while in the second case we obtain the complete noise
budget. We analyze the correlation between successive scans. First empirical investigations with diierent material were
performed and the results are presented.
